alert.note: Alert for Okmulgee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:29AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Craig, Rogers, Mayes, Wagoner, northwestern Cherokee, northeastern Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee and southeastern Tulsa Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 629 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oologah to 2 miles south of Claremore to 2 miles northeast of Oneta to 2 miles north of Bald Hill. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Claremore... Wagoner... Pryor... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Fort Gibson... Verdigris... Chouteau... Haskell... Chelsea... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Oologah... Adair... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 239 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
